member.name: DXGI_ADAPTER_DESC2
member.summary: Describes an adapter (or video card) that uses Microsoft DirectX Graphics Infrastructure (DXGI) 1.2.

member.name: DXGI_ADAPTER_DESC2.Description
member.summary: A string that contains the adapter description.

member.name: DXGI_ADAPTER_DESC2.VendorId
member.summary: The PCI ID of the hardware vendor.

member.name: DXGI_ADAPTER_DESC2.DeviceId
member.summary: The PCI ID of the hardware device.

member.name: DXGI_ADAPTER_DESC2.SubSysId
member.summary: The PCI ID of the sub system.

member.name: DXGI_ADAPTER_DESC2.Revision
member.summary: The PCI ID of the revision number of the adapter.

member.name: DXGI_ADAPTER_DESC2.DedicatedVideoMemory
member.summary: The number of bytes of dedicated video memory that are not shared with the CPU.

member.name: DXGI_ADAPTER_DESC2.DedicatedSystemMemory
member.summary: The number of bytes of dedicated system memory that are not shared with the CPU. This memory is allocated from available system memory at boot time.

member.name: DXGI_ADAPTER_DESC2.SharedSystemMemory
member.summary: The number of bytes of shared system memory. This is the maximum value of system memory that may be consumed by the adapter during operation. Any incidental memory consumed by the driver as it manages and uses video memory is additional.

member.name: DXGI_ADAPTER_DESC2.AdapterLuid
member.summary: A unique value that identifies the adapter. See LUID for a definition of the structure. LUID is defined in dxgi.h.

member.name: DXGI_ADAPTER_DESC2.Flags
member.summary: A value of the enumerated type that describes the adapter type. The DXGI_ADAPTER_FLAG_REMOTE flag is reserved.

member.name: DXGI_ADAPTER_DESC2.GraphicsPreemptionGranularity
member.summary: A value of the enumerated type that describes the granularity level at which the GPU can be preempted from performing its current graphics rendering task.

member.name: DXGI_ADAPTER_DESC2.ComputePreemptionGranularity
member.summary: A value of the enumerated type that describes the granularity level at which the GPU can be preempted from performing its current compute task.
